marketNews.title: Compilation of Adaro Group Performance 2024
marketNews.content:
Adaro Group announced its performance for 2024. The details are presented by each listed company:

Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI)
- AADI recorded net profit of US$1.21 billion for 2024, a 5.9% year‑over‑year increase. The result was slightly below our estimate (94.8% of Stockbit estimate) but in line with consensus expectations (98.3% of consensus estimate).
- Quarterly and annual performance comparison for 4Q24 cannot be made because data for 3Q24 is unavailable as it was still consolidated within Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO).
- The net profit growth in 2024 was mainly driven by other income that rose about 30 times to US$339 million, together with a profit of US$322.9 million from the sale of the stake in Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR).
- On the operating side, AADI's revenue fell 10.1% YoY in 2024 due to a decline in average selling price (ASP) of 16.5% YoY, although sales volume grew 7.4% YoY. Cost of goods sold decreased 8% YoY, resulting in a gross profit margin of 27.6% (2023: 29.2%).
- For 2025, AADI targets thermal coal sales volume of 65‑67 million tonnes, 1.6‑4.5% lower YoY than the 2024 realization, with a stripping ratio of 4.3x (2024: 4.4x). AADI plans capex of US$250‑300 million for 2025.

Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO)
- ADRO recorded net profit of US$1.38 billion for 2024, a 15.9% YoY decline, in line with consensus expectations (102.5% of consensus).
- Quarterly and annual performance comparison for 4Q24 cannot be made because pro‑forma 3Q24 data, which would de‑consolidate AADI, is unavailable.
- The profit decline was caused by a 23.5% YoY drop in revenue from discontinued operations, following the loss of control over AADI after its spin‑off in December 2024. For the 2024 fiscal year, ADRO still recognized revenue from AADI until 6 December 2024. Excluding the AADI profit, ADRO's continuing‑operations net profit fell only 2.4% YoY.
- Operationally, ADRO's revenue decreased 2.7% YoY in 2024, mainly due to a 12.9% YoY decline in the mining services segment. On the cost side, operating expenses rose 49.4% YoY in 2024, compressing the operating profit margin to 35.3% (2023: 36.2%).

Adaro Minerals Indonesia (ADMR)
- ADMR recorded net profit of US$105 million in 4Q24, a 25.8% QoQ increase but a 45.1% YoY decline. The full‑year 2024 net profit was US$437 million, down 1% YoY, slightly above consensus (105% of consensus).
- The quarterly profit rise in 4Q24 was driven by a 33.9% QoQ revenue increase, supported by a 50.8% QoQ volume growth, despite an ASP decline of 11.2% QoQ. However, cost of goods sold rose 35% QoQ and operating expenses rose 69.5% QoQ, lowering the operating margin to 41.5% in 4Q24 (3Q24: 42.7%).
- For 2025, ADMR targets metallurgical coal sales volume of 5.6‑6.1 million tonnes (2024: 5.6 million tonnes) with a stripping ratio of 3.3x (2024: 3.6x). ADMR plans capex of US$300‑325 million in 2025 (2024 capex: US$600‑700 million).

Key Takeaway
For 2025, besides coal price fluctuations, the Adaro Group's performance will be influenced by sales volume and stripping ratio. Based on guidance, AADI's performance may decline due to lower sales targets compared with 2024 while maintaining a stable stripping ratio. ADMR and ADRO are expected to be stable or only slightly weaker, given potential volume growth amid weakening metallurgical coal prices.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg reports delay of Indonesia's January 2025 budget report
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the delayed monthly APBN (state budget) report for January 2025 caused investors to question the government's financial condition. As of Wednesday 5 March, the government had not released the January 2025 APBN balance. The Ministry of Finance said the delay was due to a tight schedule. Normally the government holds a briefing on the APBN position 2‑3 weeks after the end of the month. The January 2025 APBN report is highly anticipated because President Prabowo Subianto issued a budget efficiency instruction for ministries and agencies amounting to 306.7 trillion rupiah in that month.

marketNews.title: China Premier Li Qiang targets 5% GDP growth in 2025
marketNews.content: China Premier Li Qiang said on Wednesday 5 March that the Chinese government targets economic growth of about 5% year‑over‑year in 2025, marking the same target for three consecutive years despite an ongoing trade war escalation with the United States. The target is higher than the consensus expectation of 4.5% YoY. The Chinese government also raised its fiscal deficit target from 3% of GDP in 2024 to 4% of GDP in 2025, in line with consensus. Li promised that China's economic policy focus will be on boosting consumption and hinted at a loose monetary policy to stimulate domestic demand.

marketNews.title: US Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick discusses possible tariff relief for Mexico and Canada
marketNews.content: US Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday 4 March that the United States may announce tariff relief for goods from Mexico and Canada covered by the US‑Mexico‑Canada Agreement (USMCA). The trade pact was originally negotiated by the Trump administration. Lutnick clarified that the US will not eliminate tariffs for Canada and Mexico but may adjust tariff rates slightly, with a decision expected on Wednesday 5 March. His remarks came after the US officially implemented a 25% import tariff on Canada and Mexico, with an exemption for Canadian energy imports that are subject to a 10% tariff.

marketNews.title: International Tin Association reports Myanmar's Wa State ready to issue mining licences
marketNews.content: The International Tin Association reported that the Wa State authority in Myanmar announced its readiness to receive applications for mining and processing licences at the Man Maw tin mine, indicating that the mine could reopen by the end of this year after being suspended in August 2023. Myanmar is the world's third‑largest tin producer after China and Indonesia, and Man Maw was the country's largest tin mine before suspension. However, Reuters metal columnist Andy Home explained that the Wa State announcement is only the first step toward a full reopening, as it will take several months for workers—especially those from China—to obtain work permits and return to Myanmar even after mining licences are granted. Home also argued that the Man Maw reopening will not immediately solve the global tin supply issue, noting that a major tin mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo is facing increased security risks from local rebels.

marketNews.title: ANRPC senior economist warns global natural rubber shortfall in 2025
marketNews.content: Senior economist Lekshmi Nair of the Association of Natural Rubber Producing Countries (ANRPC) told Reuters that global natural rubber production in 2025 will remain lower than consumption growth, creating a supply deficit for the fifth consecutive year. ANRPC estimates worldwide natural rubber output in 2025 will grow only 0.3% YoY to 14.9 million tonnes, while demand is projected to increase 1.8% YoY to 15.6 million tonnes. For Indonesia, ANRPC forecasts a 9.8% YoY decline in production to 2.04 million tonnes. Nair explained that the global rubber shortage is caused by low replanting rates due to low prices over the past 7‑8 years, before prices rose to a 13‑year high at the end of 2024.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu purchases 1.3 million shares of BREN
tickerNews.content: Controlling shareholder of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, bought 1.3 million shares of BREN at an average price of 6,077 rupiah per share on 4 March 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 7.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BREN increased from 0.09896% to 0.09993%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri plans to issue up to 5 trillion rupiah of green bonds
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri intends to issue sustainable green bonds with a total amount of up to 5 trillion rupiah. The proceeds will be used to finance and/or refinance environmentally‑focused business activities. The bonds, rated idAAA by Pefindo, consist of a 370‑day tenor and a 3‑year tenor, with interest rates of 6.35% and 6.65% respectively. The public offering is expected to run from 18 to 20 March 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia explains recent share price decline
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia explained to the IDX that the recent decline in its share price over the past year was caused by two main factors: 1) macro‑economic conditions pressuring the bank's primary market, which is the middle‑low income segment; and 2) a deterioration in asset quality, partly indicated by an increase in cost of credit. BBRI stated it will continue to implement various improvement actions and anticipatory measures in loan underwriting, key performance indicators, and portfolio management to ensure growth with good quality and optimal profitability.

tickerNews.title: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia announces share buyback up to 234.5 million shares
tickerNews.content: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia plans to conduct a share buyback of up to 234.5 million shares, representing 2% of its total shares, with a maximum fund allocation of 470 billion rupiah. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 10 April 2025.

tickerNews.title: Erajaya Swasembada shareholder PT Eralink International buys 65.9 million ERAA shares
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Erajaya Swasembada, PT Eralink International, purchased 65.9 million shares of ERAA at an average price of 364 rupiah per share on 28 February 2025. The total transaction value was about 24 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Eralink International's ownership in ERAA increased from 54.51% to 54.93%.

tickerNews.title: Matahari Department Store plans share buyback up to 10% of shares
tickerNews.content: Matahari Department Store intends to conduct a share buyback of up to 10% of its shares, with a maximum fund allocation of 150 billion rupiah. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders meeting on 10 April 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bain Capital Credit Member LLC purchases 1.3 billion SRAJ shares
tickerNews.content: Bain Capital Credit Member LLC announced the purchase of 1.3 billion shares of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ) at an average price of 636 rupiah per share between 26‑28 February 2025, totaling approximately 817 billion rupiah. The transaction also included a private placement of 238 million new shares at an average price of 2,200 rupiah per share, and the purchase of 1.05 billion shares from the controlling shareholder PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang at an average price of 280 rupiah per share. After the transaction, Bain Capital Credit Member LLC's ownership in SRAJ increased from zero to 10.5%, while PT Surya Cipta Inti Cemerlang's ownership fell from 58.82% to 50.27%.

tickerNews.title: Director of PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat resigns
tickerNews.content: The President Director of PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat (BJBR), Yuddy Renaldi, submitted his resignation for personal reasons. The resignation plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders meeting on 16 April 2025. Previously, the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) was investigating alleged corruption in BJBR's advertising procurement for the period 2021‑2023.

tickerNews.title: Indo Kordsa halts production due to force majeure from flooding
tickerNews.content: Indo Kordsa (BRAM) announced that all its production activities have been temporarily halted because of a force majeure caused by flooding at its plant located in Citeureup, Bogor Regency. The impact of the force majeure is not yet clear, but the company is conducting cleaning and repair work to restore operations as soon as possible.

tickerNews.title: Bakrie & Brothers and VKTR discuss potential share buyback
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bakrie & Brothers (BNBR) and President Commissioner of VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas (VKTR), Anindya Bakrie, said that the Bakrie Group is currently evaluating a possible share buyback, without specifying which company would carry out the action. Besides BNBR and VKTR, the Bakrie Group also includes Energi Mega Persada (ENRG), Bumi Resources (BUMI), and Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS).
